se.cbb.jprime.topology

Interface RootedBifurcatingTree

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AcyclicDigraph, Graph, RootedTree
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RootedBifurcatingTreeParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RBTree

    public interface RootedBifurcatingTree
extends RootedTree
    Specialisation constraining a rooted tree to be bifurcating, i.e. interior vertices and the root have out-degree 2, whereas leaves have out-degree 0. See the super-interface for more details.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Detail

      • getLeftChild

        int getLeftChild(int x)
        Returns the left child of a vertex x. If x is a leaf, NULL (as defined in the interface) is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the left child of x.

      • getRightChild

        int getRightChild(int x)
        Returns the right child of a vertex x. If x is a leaf, NULL (as defined in the super-interface) is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the right child of x.

      • getSibling

        int getSibling(int x)
        Returns the sibling of a vertex x (i.e. its parents other child). If x is the root, NULL (as defined in the super-interface) is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the sibling of x.
